channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: South Korea’s opposition prepares to impeach the country’s acting president as political crisis deepens
item.description: Han Duck-soo is refusing to fill vacancies on the Constitutional Court, currently evaluating the impeachment of suspended president Yoon Suk Yeol.

item.title: Plane Crash Investigators Focus on Russian Air Defenses as Possible Cause

item.title: Burned out workers ditch hustle culture for ‘slow living’ trend of old-fashioned wood-burning stoves and unstructured play

item.title: Former Yahoo CEO Marissa Mayer was Google’s first female engineer—only because she tried to delete a recruiter email and accidentally opened it instead
item.description: Mayer's career can be boiled down to a single wrong keystroke.

item.title: Syrian Government Forces Hunt for Senior Assad Official
item.description: Syria’s new government is searching for a senior official from the Assad dictatorship and for military forces loyal to the ousted president.

item.title: Norway Bus Plunges Into Lake, Killing at Least 2
item.description: The bus, which was carrying more than 50 people, was partly submerged after leaving a road in the country’s northwest.

item.title: Workplace well-being is at an all-time low. Here are 5 ways employers can actually help
item.description: “Without a supportive workplace culture and strong leadership,” says one expert, “even the best perks feel hollow and performative.”
